item.title: How To Watch the Premier League in the US
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
Learn how to watch Premier League matches in the U.S. with our comprehensive viewing guide. We explore what Peacock and other NBCUniversal channels offer English football fans this season.

The post How To Watch the Premier League in the US appeared first on CableTV.com.

Peacock is a must-have streaming service for soccer fans in the U.S. to watch the English Premier League (EPL). Just under half of the league’s 380 games stream exclusively on Peacock, with NBC match simulcasts also available on the service. But you’ll need USA Network to catch other matches not streaming on Peacock.

To get Peacock, you must subscribe to one of its premium plans—starting at $10.99 a month. Not only will you receive around 175 live Premier League games per season, but you’ll also have thousands of movies and TV shows at your fingertips. As for USA Network, you’ll need a cable, satellite, or live TV streaming plan to pick up the channel.

Keep reading to learn more about how to watch the Premier League in the U.S. We update this guide regularly with the league’s U.S. TV schedule and channel listings to help you tune in.

Jump to:

  • Premier League channels
  • Premier League TV schedule
  • Best Premier League TV plans

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels show Premier League games?

Premier League fans in the U.S. can watch every match across NBC, Peacock, and USA Network. If you prefer Spanish-language commentary, Telemundo, UNIVERSO, and Peacock carry select games en Español.

Some matches may appear on other NBCUniversal networks, such as CNBC, Golf Channel, and Syfy, especially on Championship Sunday. But Peacock often simultaneously streams those games and all matches that air on NBC.

Pro tip: Fans of England women’s soccer can catch many Women’s Super League and Women’s Championship matches on the Barclays WSL and Barclays WC YouTube channels. Some WSL games also stream on ESPN+.

Premier League TV schedule

The 2025–2026 Premier League season began on August 15, 2025, and wrap up with Championship Sunday on May 24, 2026. Keep in mind that all match times are subject to change due to cup competitions and weather, which is why we update this section nearly every week of the season.

Below, you’ll find a list of the upcoming matchday fixtures with U.S. kickoff times and channel listings. You can also visit the official Premier League Matches webpage to see the entire calendar.

Data effective as of post date.

Best TV plans for watching the Premier League

Peacock is an essential part of watching the Premier League in the U.S. Yet, to enjoy every game this season, you must supplement Peacock with a TV provider that carries USA Network.

Fortunately, Peacock is an inexpensive service. Its premium plans start at $10.99/mo., and grant you access to nearly half of this season’s Premier League games. On top of that, Peacock includes thousands of movies and TV shows alongside additional live sports. We’re talking NFL, Premiership Rugby, and WWE events. You even get complete Spanish-language access to the FIFA World Cup and FIFA Women’s World Cup each time those tournaments come around.

The cheapest way to get USA Network is through Sling TV. The live TV streaming service offers the channel in its Sling Blue plan for $45.99/mo. But if you have more room in your budget, Hulu + Live TV also has NBC Sports channels and includes ESPN+ at no extra cost—giving you live FA Cup, La Liga, and Bundesliga games. Unfortunately, you’ll also need Paramount+ in your streaming roster if you want robust EFL Championship and League One coverage.

What TV providers carry Premier League games?

Most cable, satellite, and live TV streaming services carry Premier League games via NBC, CNBC, and USA Network. But as shown in our table below, some providers don’t have any NBCUniversal channels.

Find the best provider for watching soccer

Provider coverage varies by location, so enter your zip code below to see top-ranked options in your area.

Premier League content on Peacock

Peacock has a wealth of Premier League content. It streams around 175 live games and occasionally offers multiview coverage. With Peacock, you can also watch on-demand replays of all 380 league matchups each season. Replays of games that didn’t originally air live on Peacock become available 24 hours after the match ends and are available to stream for 30 days.

Outside of actual games, Peacock is also home to Premier League studio shows, highlights, and docuseries. There’s even a 24/7 live channel called Premier League TV that really comes in handy on transfer deadline days.

What’s great about Premier League TV is that it airs a mixture of U.S.- and U.K.-produced content. This means you’ll get the best of both worlds with NBC Sports and Sky Sports programming. We particularly enjoy The Kelly & Wrighty Show, which features presenter Kelly Cates and Arsenal legend Ian Wright.

Here’s a list of Premier League programs featured on Peacock:

  • The 2 Robbies
  • The Analysis Show
  • The Big Interview
  • The Catch Up Show
  • Fantasy Premier League

  • Headline Makers

  • The Weekend Review

How to watch the Premier League for free

Get Free Local Channels

View on Amazon
Read Mohu Leaf review

†CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

You can watch Premier League games free in the U.S. using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna to pick up your local NBC or Telemundo station. Unfortunately, neither channel is available in every corner of the country. But you can use the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to verify if they’re within range.

There isn’t a free way to access Premier League games on Peacock. However, you can sign up for a live TV streaming trial to watch games on NBC and USA Network without paying. Fubo offers a seven-day free trial and provides access to both channels.

How to watch the Premier League FAQ

Is the Premier League free on Peacock?

No, the Premier League is not free on Peacock. To watch live Premier League matches on Peacock, you must subscribe to one of its premium plans (starting at $10.99 a month).

Does Peacock Premium have all Premier League games?

No, Peacock Premium doesn’t have all Premier League games available to stream live—but it does have every game available to stream on demand. Games that don’t appear live on Peacock will air on USA Network or CNBC for English-language coverage and UNIVERSO for Spanish-language coverage. These games will become available as full match replays on Peacock 24 hours after they end.

Do Peacock ads interrupt Premier League games?

No, ads don’t interrupt ongoing Premier League matches. You’ll see commercials before and after each half, regardless of whether you subscribe to the ad-based Peacock Premium ($10.99 a month) or the ad-free Peacock Premium Plus ($16.99 a month).

What app has Premier League games?

You can catch live Premier League games on the Peacock app and the NBC Sports app. You’ll need a Peacock Premium subscription to watch Premier League games on the Peacock app, while the NBC Sports app requires you to log in with your TV provider’s credentials.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, has been an avid Premier League fan for over a decade. He deeply understands the main frustration for U.S. fans: the weekly channel shuffle between NBC, USA Network, and Peacock.

To create this guide, Taylor combined his hands-on experience as a Peacock subscriber with research into NBC Sports’ U.S. broadcast deal (which runs through the 2027–2028 season). He also compared Peacock’s value and Premier League game count with traditional TV options.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch the Los Angeles Lakers: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Finn
item.description:
The Los Angeles Lakers are always must-see TV. To help you tune in, we’ve compiled the complete 2025–2026 TV schedule, channel lineup, and best streaming plans.

The post How To Watch the Los Angeles Lakers: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
One day, we’re going through the motions, and the next, we wake up to see that Luka Doncic has been traded to the LA Lakers. I’m sorry, what? After shipping out Anthony Davis, the Lakers have created one of the most fascinating superstar pairings in recent memory.
Naturally, the move sparked intense buzz and plenty of doubts. Concerns immediately centered on Luka’s conditioning, AD’s health, the Lakers’ already poor defense, and LeBron nearing the end of his career.

The Lakers also acquired Marcus Smart and Deandre Ayton over the summer, but lost a premier 3-and-D guy in Dorian Finney-Smith. The dilemma is clear: Luka has to stay in shape and tighten up his defense, and LeBron is literally on his way out the door. I feel like it’s now or never.

The Lakers clearly wanted to secure their future by getting another superstar, so I give them kudos on that. But whether they’ll make any progress with both Luka and LeBron remains to be seen. To make sure you don’t miss any of the action this season, here’s a complete look at how to watch Los Angeles Lakers games on TV.

Jump to:

  • Los Angeles Lakers channels
  • Los Angeles Lakers TV schedule
  • Best Los Angeles Lakers TV plans
  • Watch the Lakers for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Los Angeles Lakers games?

You can watch most regular-season Lakers games on Spectrum SportsNet, the team’s regional TV partner. But you’ll also need access to ABC, ESPN, and NBC to catch nationally televised broadcasts. Amazon Prime Video and Peacock are also in the mix, as they hold the exclusive streaming rights to several matchups.

If you’re outside the Spectrum SportsNet TV market, NBA League Pass is your best option for watching out-of-market games. Just keep in mind that blackout rules still apply to any game airing locally or nationally in your area.

Want radio coverage? You can also catch every Lakers game locally on 710 AM ESPN Radio, with Spanish-language broadcasts on 1330 AM Tu Liga Radio. For fans on the go, national coverage is available through SiriusXM NBA Radio.

2025–2026 Los Angeles Lakers TV schedule

People had huge expectations for the Luka Dončić and LeBron James duo to make real noise in last season’s playoffs. Instead, the defense fell flat, and they lost to the Timberwolves in Round 1. Now, after viral videos of “Skinny Luka” and LeBron James doing his thing, fans want to know if they’ve finally put it all together.

Of course, it’s never easy in the West. You’ve still got to worry about three-time-MVP Nikola Jokic, the legendary Steph Curry, and “Easy Money Sniper” Kevin Durant, who just joined an already-dangerous Rockets team. It’s going to be a battle every single night.

To help you follow along, I’ve laid out the complete Los Angeles Lakers TV schedule in the table below. I’ll keep it updated all season with the latest tip-off times and channel listings.

Best TV plans for watching the Los Angeles Lakers

It’s important to stay on top of your TV options, as the NBA and individual teams occasionally strike new media deals. With the way things have panned out lately, catching every Lakers game means combining a few different services. While no single provider covers everything, I recommend Stream with DIRECTV as the strongest starting point.

DIRECTV is the only live TV streaming platform that includes Spectrum SportsNet, the must-have channel for in-market broadcasts. It also carries all the national staples, like ABC, ESPN, NBC, and NBA TV. That comprehensive lineup ensures you won’t miss local broadcasts or high-profile national matchups.

The service is feature-rich, too. It offers unlimited DVR and a sports-friendly interface that lets you track your favorite teams. For full season coverage, though, you’ll still need separate subscriptions to Amazon Prime Video and Peacock for their exclusive NBA games. And if you’re outside the Lakers TV market, NBA League Pass remains the best way to pick up those Spectrum SportsNet broadcasts (subject to blackout rules, of course).

Standalone in-market TV package for Lakers games

Are you a Lakers fan looking for a more flexible way to stream in-market games? Expensive TV providers like DIRECTV, Spectrum, or Cox aren’t your only options.

Spectrum SportsNet+ is a direct-to-consumer service that delivers over 70 live Lakers games, as well as pre- and post-game coverage. Since I’ve streamed games through the NBA app before, I know how slick the viewing experience is, and this service is available directly through the NBA’s app and website.

At just $19.99 per month, Spectrum SportsNet+ totally beats having to pay $80+ for a bulky live TV package just for one crucial channel. My favorite part is that it even comes with dedicated content for Los Angeles Sparks fans, who get live games and exclusive programming during the WNBA season. If you live in Southern California, Hawaii, or the southern tip of Nevada, this is your complete, in-market streaming solution.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Lakers for free

Enjoying the Lakers doesn’t always require a pricey subscription. Many streaming services offer free trial periods, including DIRECTV, Fubo, and YouTube TV. That gives you a short window to watch nationally televised games without paying, and it’s also a handy way to test which platform feels right for you.

Old-school tricks still work, too. With more NBA games shifting to ABC and NBC, a simple digital antenna can unlock several Lakers broadcasts at no cost. I just recommend using Antennas Direct’s TV Transmitter Locator to check your local coverage.

How to watch the Los Angeles Lakers FAQ

Which channel shows the most Lakers games?

The majority of regular-season Lakers games air locally on Spectrum SportsNet. The regional sports network is available throughout Southern and Central California, Hawaii, and the Las Vegas area. If you live outside of that broadcast territory, you’ll need NBA League Pass to watch those broadcasts.

Will the Lakers be on national TV often?

Yes, absolutely. As one of the league’s most high-profile franchises, the Lakers routinely get heavy national coverage. Expect plenty of appearances on ABC, ESPN, NBC, Amazon Prime Video, and Peacock.

How can I watch Lakers games without cable?

Local Lakers fans can avoid a cable subscription by signing up for Spectrum SportsNet+ or a live TV streaming service that carries Spectrum SportsNet (like DIRECTV). For those outside the Lakers’ broadcast territory, you’ll need an NBA League Pass subscription for out-of-market coverage.

How can I keep up with Lakers games while traveling?

When you’re traveling out of market, you’ll need NBA League Pass access to watch most Lakers games. But national matchups will still be exclusive to specific channels and platforms regardless of your location in the U.S.

Who are the TV announcers for the Los Angeles Lakers?

A veteran duo holds down the broadcast booth for Lakers games on Spectrum SportsNet. You’ll hear longtime play-by-play announcer Bill Macdonald alongside color commentator and former Laker, Stu Lantz.

Why you should trust us

CableTV.com contributor Creshonda Smith pulled together this Lakers viewing guide by researching the latest broadcast setups, blackout rules, and schedule details. She meticulously tracked roster updates, new media deals, and streaming changes to make sure every angle was covered.

Creshonda’s goal is to give every fan a smooth viewing experience. From sorting out Spectrum SportsNet access to flagging when games shift to national networks, this guide has everything you need so you can just focus on enjoying Lakers basketball.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch the Sacramento Kings: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Finn
item.description:
Ready to Light the Beam? Don’t miss a single Sacramento Kings game. Our guide has the complete 2025–2026 TV schedule, channel listings, and top streaming picks.

The post How To Watch the Sacramento Kings: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The Sacramento Kings entered 2025 with big ambitions. They traded longtime point guard De’Aaron Fox to the Spurs in a massive three-team deal, landing Zach LaVine, Sidy Cissoko, and several draft picks. Then, the Kings added veteran guard Dennis Schröder to round out the roster. The hope is that this new-look squad can recapture the glory Sacramento showed in their riveting playoff series against the Warriors a few years back.
They’ll still lean on DeMar DeRozan and Domantas Sabonis to steady the lineup as the roster adapts. With Doug Christie now in the head coaching chair, this is a pivotal season where cohesion, health, and chemistry will make or break their run.

Fans should be on the lookout to see if the new pieces gel with the established core this season. To make sure you don’t miss a thing, keep reading for my complete rundown on how to watch every Kings game on TV.

What channels have Sacramento Kings games?

Most Sacramento Kings games air locally on NBC Sports California, the team’s regional broadcast partner. For fans outside the Sacramento area, your go-to service for these games will be NBA League Pass.

A handful of high-profile NBA games will also air nationally on channels like ABC, ESPN, NBC, and NBA TV. Additionally, select Kings games will stream exclusively on Amazon Prime Video and Peacock.

Want radio coverage? The Sacramento Kings offer live radio coverage through Sactown Sports 1140 AM (KHTK). Fans across Northern California can also tune in through the Sacramento Kings Radio Network, which includes affiliates in cities like Auburn and Redding.

2025–2026 Sacramento Kings TV schedule

Sacramento’s schedule is rich with narrative threads, like De’Aaron Fox returning to Golden 1 Center in a Spurs uniform. That’ll certainly tilt some matchups into personal territory.

Beyond the emotional rematches, other must-see games include Zach LaVine’s debut and his first clash with his former Bulls squad. You’ll also want to circle the high-stakes showdowns against Western Conference elite like the Nuggets and Thunder. With Domantas Sabonis still anchoring the frontcourt, every marquee home game becomes an audition for chemistry.

To help you follow along with all the drama, I’ve laid out the complete 2025–2026 Kings TV schedule below. I’ll be keeping it updated with all the latest start times and broadcast information.

Best TV plans for watching the Sacramento Kings

The NBA’s latest media deal makes watching every Kings game slightly more complex. To simplify things, I’ve broken down my top provider recommendations for every type of Kings fan.

For anyone living in the Northern California market, your top priority is getting NBC Sports California. Typically, I recommend Stream with DIRECTV as the best all-in-one service for NBA and NHL coverage. But you can actually go with YouTube TV as a slightly cheaper option that still delivers NBC Sports California alongside the league’s main national channels. You’ll also get unlimited DVR storage and, my personal favorite, multiview capabilities.

If you’re an out-of-market fan, your most essential subscription will be NBA League Pass. That’ll get you those NBC Sports California broadcasts outside the greater NorCal area.

And don’t forget, you’ll still need separate subscriptions to Amazon Prime Video and Peacock for their exclusive games. But since the Kings only have a few games on those platforms this season, you can probably wait to subscribe until those specific matchups roll around.

Standalone in-market TV package for Kings games

For local cord-cutters, NBC Sports California is also available to stream directly through Peacock. This is a fantastic option if you don’t want a big, expensive live TV package. For $17.95 per month on top of a base Peacock Premium plan, you’ll get access to almost every regular-season Kings game this campaign. Really, you’ll just miss the few games on ESPN and Prime Video.

What I appreciate most about this setup is the flexibility. You can subscribe on a monthly basis, so you’re not locked into a long-term plan. Plus, the add-on includes in-market San Jose Sharks games, making it a great value for any NorCal sports fan.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Sacramento Kings for free

Catching Kings games without paying full price is possible if you know where to look. Many live TV streaming platforms, such as DIRECTV, Fubo, and YouTube TV, offer free trial periods. These usually last around five days and include access to national broadcasters.

Fans nationwide can also pick up select NBA games on ABC and NBC with a digital antenna. This option is a one-time purchase and works especially well in urban areas with strong over-the-air signals.

Lastly, the NBA app is worth keeping on your device. While live games often require a subscription of some kind, the app occasionally provides free national streams or live radio broadcasts. It’s also just nice to have for catching league highlights and game clips throughout the season.

How to watch the Sacramento Kings FAQ

Do I need cable to watch the Kings on NBC Sports California?

No, you can get NBC Sports California through live TV streaming services like DIRECTV and Fubo. Peacock also offers the channel as an add-on subscription. Whichever option you choose, you must reside within the NBC Sports California TV market.

Is NBC Sports California on Peacock?

Yes, you can purchase NBC Sports California access as a direct add-on through Peacock. Just remember that availability varies by location, as standard blackout rules still apply.

How can I watch the Kings if I’m out of market?

You can use NBA League Pass to watch out-of-market regular-season games. But you’ll still need separate access to national broadcasts airing on platforms like Amazon Prime Video and ESPN.

Why are some Sacramento Kings games blacked out?

Kings games are blacked out on services like NBA League Pass due to local and national restrictions. A local blackout occurs when the game airs on your in-market NBA team’s regional channel. Meanwhile, national blackouts happen when a game is exclusive to major networks like ESPN or NBC.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Contributing Writer, Creshonda Smith, spent hours reviewing the Sacramento Kings’ 2025–2026 broadcast details to make this comprehensive guide. She reviewed NBC Sports California’s coverage policies, confirmed national TV partners, and cross-checked streaming availability across all viewing options.

Creshonda vetted every piece of information for accuracy, ensuring Kings fans know exactly when and where to watch their team. For more insight into how we evaluate TV providers and streaming options, check out our How We Rank page.

item.title: How To Watch the Portland Trail Blazers: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide

Here’s how to watch the Portland Trail Blazers this NBA season. Our viewing guide has the entire 2025–2026 TV schedule, channel listings, and top TV providers.

The post How To Watch the Portland Trail Blazers: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
I’m sure I’m not alone when I say the 2024–2025 NBA season threw me for a loop. After Damian Lillard suffered a catastrophic, season-ending injury in Milwaukee, the league dropped a bombshell this summer. Dame decided to come home to Portland as he continues to rehab his torn Achilles.

The other surprise? The Celtics traded Jrue Holiday back to the Trail Blazers. With two dynamic point guards, some scrappy defenders, and a ton of sharpshooting, this team has a recipe for success. But as we all know, we’ll have to wait and see if the pieces actually come together.

While we won’t see Dame on the court this year, I’m excited to see this new-look team try to reshape its identity. To help you watch the Portland Trail Blazers through this fascinating season, I’ve created this complete guide to their TV schedule and viewing options.

Jump to:

  • Portland Trail Blazers channels
  • Portland Trail Blazers TV schedule
  • Best Trail Blazers TV plans
  • Watch the Trail Blazers for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Portland Trail Blazers games?

You can watch most in-market Trail Blazers broadcasts for free on the Rip City Television Network, a collection of over-the-air channels led by KUNP in Portland. For local cord-cutters, the team also offers BlazerVision, a direct-to-consumer streaming service that carries all the same games.

This season, select Trail Blazers games will appear exclusively on Amazon Prime Video, NBC, and Pecock. You’ll also want ABC, ESPN, and NBA TV in our arsenal for other nationally televised NBA games.

Meanwhile, NBA League Pass remains the best way to follow the Blazers if you’re outside Oregon and Washington. It’ll carry those Rip City TV Network games for out-of-market fans.

Want radio coverage? The official radio home of the Trail Blazers is Rip City Radio 620 AM. You can listen on the radio in the Portland area or stream games from anywhere using the iHeartRadio app.

2025–2026 Portland Trail Blazers TV schedule

Regardless of whether it’ll be quite some time before we see the Trail Blazers thriving, Portland’s 2025–2026 season is worth a watch. Point guard Scoot Henderson is expected to take on a bigger role, though a hamstring injury could sideline him for several weeks.

Matchups carry an extra charge this year, too. Be on the lookout for Anfernee Simons’ return to Rip City in a Celtics uniform, and games where Portland’s youth challenges veteran-led squads. The Blazers will test themselves against Western Conference powerhouses like Denver, OKC, and the Clippers.

You can expect more national exposure than in past seasons, thanks to roster changes and the rising star power of Holiday and Henderson. Whether you’re tuning in locally or from afar, I can tell you there are plenty of games worth marking ahead. Check out the full Portland Trail Blazers TV schedule below.

Best TV plans for watching the Portland Trail Blazers

The best part about being a local Trail Blazers fan is that most games are free to watch on TV. That all depends on whether your antenna can pick up Rip City TV Network affiliates in your area. Fortunately, the network’s flagship channel, KUNP, and other KATU affiliates are widely available across Oregon and Washington.

If you want full coverage this season, you’ll still need a way to watch the national games. My top recommendation for a complete TV package is Stream with DIRECTV. It’s one of the few live TV streaming services that carries local Rip City TV Network affiliates and key national channels. Just remember, you’ll still need separate subscriptions to Amazon Prime Video and Pecock for their exclusive games.

Of course, out-of-market fans will still need NBA League Pass. DIRECTV’s streaming service no longer offers it as an add-on, but you can still get a standalone subscription online.

Standalone in-market TV package for Blazers games

For fans in Oregon and Washington, BlazerVision is a streaming subscription that carries every Rip City TV Network game. It costs $120 per season and delivers live broadcasts, replays, and behind-the-scenes content directly through the NBA app or NBA.com.

Compatible with iOS, Android, Roku, Apple TV, Fire TV, and most smart TVs, BlazerVision is a really straightforward service. But I like it for its clean, team-first approach. It’s ideal for local fans who want full-season access without committing to an expensive live TV service.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Trail Blazers for free

There are a few clever ways to follow the Trail Blazers without committing to a full-season TV package. For local broadcasts, Portland games now appear on the Rip City Television Network, accessible with a digital antenna. Last season, the team even gave away 5,000 antennas to help local fans tune in over the air.

That simple antenna can also pick up any nationally televised NBA game airing on your local ABC and NBC stations. And thanks to the league’s new media deal, there’ll be plenty of games on both channels.

Additionally, you can take advantage of free trials from streaming services like DIRECTV and Fubo. Both services let you catch nationally televised games for around five days before billing kicks in.

How to watch the Portland Trail Blazers FAQ

What channel is Rip City Television Network?

Rip City Television is an affiliate network of over-the-air channels available in Oregon and Washington. It carries the majority of Blazers regular-season games not picked up by national outlets. Fans can tune in for free with a digital antenna or watch through select live TV services.

How often will the Trail Blazers be on national TV?

Portland doesn’t draw as many national games as larger markets. During the 2025–2026 season, at least eight Trail Blazers games will air nationally across Amazon Prime Video, NBC, and Peacock.

How can I watch out-of-market Blazers games?

NBA League Pass remains the top choice for out-of-market fans. It covers Blazers games not shown on national TV, with replays available when blackout rules block live broadcasts. Combined with Amazon Prime Video and Peacock for exclusive nights, League Pass offers the most complete viewing experience.

Can I watch the Blazers without cable?

Yes, you can watch the Trail Blazers without a cable subscription, even if your local provider is Spectrum or Xfinity. DIRECTV and Fubo stream all in-market broadcasts, as does the standalone BlazerVision service. You can also stream select games on Prime Video and Peacock.

Did the Trail Blazers really give away free antennas?

Yes. In 2024, the team distributed 5,000 digital antennas to local fans to help them watch games on the new Rip City Television Network. The move was part of Portland’s push to make broadcasts more accessible after shifting away from regional cable exclusivity.

Why you should trust us

CableTV.com contributor Creshonda Smith put together this Trail Blazers viewing guide to help fans navigate the latest season on TV. She sifted through Portland’s new broadcast setup, cross-referenced TV schedules, and flagged the blackout issues that still trip fans up.

Our editorial team is always committed to that level of hands-on research and analysis. To learn more about our general methods, check out our How We Rank page.

item.content:encoded:
The Los Angeles Clippers didn’t just tinker this offseason—they reloaded. After a quiet stretch following their 2025 first-round exit, LA made bold moves. The team added Bradley Beal following his buyout from Phoenix, re-signed Chris Paul for his 21st NBA season, and acquired John Collins and Brook Lopez to shore up spacing and rim presence.
You’ve still got Kawhi Leonard and James Harden, but I think the roster is now deeper and more versatile than ever. With Beal’s shooting, Paul’s floor leadership, Collins’ physicality, and Lopez’s veteran savvy, LA has assembled a diverse skillset. These pieces are designed to adjust perfectly to load management and matchup demands.

Now, the real question is whether this upgraded supporting cast can elevate the Clippers past the middle playoff rounds. To help you stay tuned in, here’s your go-to guide for how to watch Los Angeles Clippers basketball this season on TV and streaming.

Jump to:

  • Los Angeles Clippers channels
  • Los Angeles Clippers schedule
  • Best LA Clippers TV plans
  • Watch the Clippers for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Los Angeles Clippers games?

You can watch the Clippers’ 2025–2026 season on local and national channels, as well as various streaming platforms.

  • Locally: In-market fans can catch most Clippers games on FanDuel Sports Network West (FDSW), which is available through providers like DIRECTV and Fubo.
  • Nationally: Clippers games will appear on ABC, ESPN, and NBC. Select high-profile matchups will also air on NBA TV.
  • Streaming: Amazon Prime Video will stream exclusive Thursday and Friday night contests, including NBA Cup games. Peacock carries Monday night matchups and all games broadcast on NBC, giving fans another way to stay tuned without cable.

If you’re outside the Clippers’ local market, NBA League Pass is the best option to watch out-of-market games not shown on national TV. As always, blackout restrictions apply, especially when the Clippers face your local NBA team.

Want radio coverage? The Los Angeles Clippers’ flagship radio station is AM 570 KLAC, with Spanish-language coverage airing on 1330 AM KWKW. You can also stream coverage online via the iHeart app, which features Clippers-specific programming and live audio.

2025–2026 Los Angeles Clippers TV schedule

The Clippers have something to prove after their seven-game first-round exit to Denver last spring. This season, the story revolves around health and chemistry. If Kawhi Leonard’s availability trends up and the Beal-Harden backcourt continues to click, LA certainly has the pieces to climb the West. Expect a healthy mix of national windows and regional broadcasts as the Clippers try to convert their talent into postseason momentum.

The 2025–2026 NBA regular-season calendar is live, so you can easily plan your viewing. Check out the complete Los Angeles Clippers TV schedule below, including game times and channel listings.

Best TV plans for watching the Los Angeles Clippers

I’m going to cut to the chase. My top pick for any Clippers fan is Stream with DIRECTV. It’s one of the few services that bundles the local FanDuel Sports Network West with all the key national channels like ESPN and NBC. While Fubo is another strong option with a similar lineup, I think DIRECTV’s user experience gives it the edge.

The user experience is another reason I recommend DIRECTV. It comes with unlimited cloud DVR storage and has a solid, sports-focused interface for following your favorite teams. The only downside is that NBA League Pass is no longer available as an add-on for out-of-market coverage. You’ll need to get that separately.

Don’t forget that Amazon Prime Video and Peacock will host exclusive NBA games this season, so you’ll need them as add-ons to follow the Clippers’ entire run. And if you don’t want a full live TV plan, the combination of Prime Video, Peacock, and ESPN Unlimited will get you nearly all of the national coverage.

Standalone in-market TV package for Clippers games

For Clippers fans living in Southern California, the FanDuel Sports Network app (formerly Bally Sports+) is the simplest way to stream local games without a cable subscription. This is the new streaming home for the team, replacing the previously offered ClipperVision service.

A subscription costs $19.99 per month and provides direct access to FanDuel Sports Network West, the Clippers’ regional broadcast partner. The app works across all your favorite devices, including Roku, Apple TV, and Amazon Fire TV, giving you a ton of flexibility.

Overall, the platform is a great hub for in-market fans, focusing on live broadcasts and Clippers-specific coverage. Subscribers also get access to game replays, real-time stats, and exclusive team content throughout the season.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Los Angeles Clippers for free

If you’re looking to watch a few Clippers games without spending any money, you’ve got several options.

For in-market fans, the FanDuel Sports Network streaming app offers a seven-day free trial. You can also try streaming services like DIRECTV and Fubo, which typically offer free trial periods of five to seven days and include access to nationally televised Clippers games.

A digital antenna is also a smart move. With the NBA’s expanded broadcast deal putting more games on ABC and NBC, you can pick up several Clippers games over the air at no cost.

How to watch the Los Angeles Clippers FAQ

Do I need cable to watch Clippers games locally?

You don’t need cable to watch local Clippers games on FanDuel Sports Network West, as it’s available through streaming services like DIRECTV and Fubo. You can also get FanDuel Sports Network access through its standalone app or Amazon Prime Video.

Does ClipperVision still exist?

Nope, ClipperVision is no longer available as of the 2025–2026 NBA season. All existing subscriptions were automatically canceled, so fans won't face any further charges.

How do I watch the Clippers if I’m out of market?

Your essential service is NBA League Pass, which covers every game not shown regionally in your area. But you’ll still need access to channels like ABC, ESPN, and NBC for live national broadcasts, which are blacked out on League Pass.

Are the Clippers still on Bally Sports?

Kind of. Bally Sports West became FanDuel Sports Network West in 2024, but it remains the Clippers’ regional broadcast partner. Through the channel, you’ll get in-market game coverage across Southern California, the Las Vegas Valley, and Hawaii.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com contributor, Creshonda Smith, put in the hours to make this Clippers TV guide as reliable as possible. She combed through the details of broadcast contracts, blackout rules, and roster changes to ensure fans have the most up-to-date information.

Creshonda and our editorial team are committed to giving every Clippers fan a clear, hassle-free plan for watching their favorite team all season. To learn more about our methods, you can check out our How We Rank page.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch the Milwaukee Brewers in 2025
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The Milwaukee Brewers return for this MLB season looking to build on last year’s National League Central triumph. Fortunately, you can watch all Brewers games live with the right channels in your TV roster.

The post How To Watch the Milwaukee Brewers in 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Looking to watch the Milwaukee Brewers today? Fortunately, you can catch all Brewers games live with the right channels and TV setup.

The Brew Crew is rolling through the 2025 MLB season with a ton of momentum, proving last year’s National League Central triumph was no fluke. With head coach Pat Murphy at the helm, the team is embracing a new era—navigating through changes while keeping its World Series dreams alive.

Although MLB was going to take over broadcasting the Brewers’ in-market games, the team ultimately struck a deal to keep local matchups on FanDuel Sports Wisconsin (formerly Bally Sports Wisconsin). That means many TV details remain unchanged from last season. But keep reading, as I outline this season’s viewing specifics—including the complete TV schedule and free viewing options.

Jump to:

  • Milwaukee Brewers channels
  • Milwaukee Brewers TV schedule
  • Spring Training schedule
  • Watch the Brewers for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Milwaukee Brewers games?

You can watch in-market Milwaukee Brewers games on FanDuel Sports Network Wisconsin (FDSWI), with select simulcasts airing on over-the-air affiliates throughout Wisconsin. Nationally televised games will appear on FOX, FS1, ESPN, TBS, and MLB Network, while some will stream on Apple TV+ and The Roku Channel.

If you live outside the FanDuel Sports Wisconsin broadcast region, you’ll need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS for out-of-market viewing.

Want radio coverage? Fans can stream home and away radio broadcasts of every Brewers game on MLB At Bat. Games also air on AM and FM stations within the Brewers Radio Network, featuring announcers Jeff Levering, Lane Grindle, and Josh Maurer.

Score the best Milwaukee Brewers TV plan

Enter your zip code below to see top TV and internet providers in your area.

2025 Milwaukee Brewers playoffs TV schedule

The Brewers began the 2025 MLB season with an Opening Day loss against the New York Yankees. In fact, they lost that entire opening series. But you wouldn’t know it now, as Milwaukee rolled into October with the spot in the National League Division Series.

Starting Saturday, October 4, the Brewers will start their journey toward a World Series against the Chicago Cubs, who beat the San Diego Padres in the Wild Card series.

The full schedule is below as we know it right now. I’ll update it as more info becomes available.

You can watch select Milwaukee Brewers games for free on ABC and FOX using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna, which requires no TV subscription. To identify channels in your area, enter your zip code in the FCC’s Reception Map Tool. Then, explore our Best OTA Antennas page for recommendations, including the mid-range Mohu Leaf 50.

Free MLB games also stream daily on MLB.TV. All you need is an MLB.com account to tune in, but blackout restrictions apply for in-market fans.

Another way to watch free games is through a live TV streaming trial. DIRECTV STREAM offers a free five-day trial with core MLB channels and RSNs, including FanDuel Sports Wisconsin. Other free trials are regularly available through Fubo and YouTube TV.

How to watch the Milwaukee Brewers FAQ

Can I watch the Brewers game on Amazon Prime?

Yes, out-of-market Brewers fans can watch games on Amazon Prime Video through the MLB.TV Prime Video Channels add-on. In-market coverage is also available on Prime Video with the FanDuel Sports Network add-on.

Have the Brewers returned to FanDuel Sports Network?

Yes, Brewers games will remain on FanDuel Sports Network (formerly Bally Sports) for the 2025 MLB season. In December 2024, the Brewers announced that they reached an agreement for FanDuel Sports Network to produce and distribute the team’s telecasts for another year.

How can I watch the Brewers on Spectrum?

Spectrum TV customers can watch nationally televised Brewers games on ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports channels. In-market fans can get FanDuel Sports Wisconsin with the TV Select Plus plan, while MLB EXTRA INNINGS is available for out-of-market fans.

Does YouTube TV carry Brewers games?

Yes, YouTube TV carries select Brewers games that air nationally. But the live TV streaming service doesn’t offer FanDuel Sports Wisconsin, MLB Network, or MLB.TV access.

How can I stream the Brewers?

You can stream Milwaukee Brewers games on any live TV streaming service that offers ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports channels. Sling TV is an inexpensive option, but I recommend DIRECTV STREAM for better in-market coverage. You can also stream in-market games on FanDuel Sports Network and out-of-market coverage on MLB.TV.

Why you should trust us

As a Wisconsin native and lifelong Brewers fan, our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, knows exactly what it takes to follow the Brew Crew. For this guide, he combined that fan passion with expert analysis, cross-referencing the full 2025 schedule with the channel lineups and pricing of every major TV provider to find the best deals for Brewers fans.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Chicago Cubs Season
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The 2025 Chicago Cubs season marks the 154th chapter of this storied franchise. After a challenging 2024 campaign, manager Craig Counsell now faces the crucial task of getting the Cubs back to the MLB Playoffs.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Chicago Cubs Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

The 2025 Chicago Cubs season marks the 154th chapter of this storied franchise. After a challenging 2024 campaign, manager Craig Counsell now faces the crucial task of getting the Cubs back to the MLB Playoffs.

This year, in-market games will continue airing on Marquee Sports Network—the exclusive home for Cubs action since 2020. Marquee is available as a standalone streaming subscription and through various TV providers, ensuring local fans get the best coverage.

With renewed energy and the potential for a playoff push, it’s time to rally behind the Cubbies. Keep reading to learn how to watch the Chicago Cubs live on TV this season, from Wrigley Field showdowns to thrilling road games.

Jump to:

  • Chicago Cubs channels
  • Chicago Cubs TV schedule
  • Chicago Cubs Spring Training schedule
  • Watch the Chicago Cubs for free

Don’t miss the Chicago Cubs on TV

Gear up for yearlong baseball action, from Spring Training to the World Series. Enter your zip code below to see the best TV and internet providers in your area.

What channels have Chicago Cubs games?

Most Chicago Cubs games air locally on Marquee Sports Network, except for select nationally televised matchups. Those games air nationwide on FOX, FS1, ESPN, TBS, and MLB Network, with some streaming on Apple TV+ and The Roku Channel.

Out-of-market viewers need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to watch the Marquee Sports Network games. But some out-of-market matchups also stream on ESPN+.

Pro tip: MLB At Bat has home and away audio broadcasts of every Chicago Cubs game without blackout restrictions. You can also listen to games on select AM and FM stations across the Midwest via the Chicago Cubs Radio Network.

2025 Chicago Cubs playoff TV schedule

The Chicago Cubs began the 2025 season with the two-game MLB Tokyo Series against the Los Angeles Dodgers at Tokyo Dome in Japan. After the brief international tour, the Cubs returned stateside for more preseason action before the regular season proper began on March 27.

As the season unfolds, you can expect thrilling matchups against National League rivals and American League powerhouses. So, mark your calendars because we’ve laid out the full TV schedule below, complete with start times and channel listings.

Chicago got past the Wild Card series against the San Diego Padres, and now the focus shifts to the Division Series against the Milwaukee Brewers. The team’s full schedule is below. I’ll update it as more information becomes available.

How to watch Chicago Cubs Spring Training games

Marquee Sports Network will broadcast the majority of the Chicago Cubs’ Spring Training games, including most Sloan Park matchups. Depending on your location, select games may also air live on MLB Network.

The 2025 Cactus League kicks off on Thursday, February 20, when the Cubs take on the Los Angeles Dodgers. I’m especially excited about this matchup since the Cubs and Dodgers will face off again in mid-March during the MLB Tokyo Series.

With a jam-packed spring schedule featuring 29 games—including split-squad contests, exhibition matches in Tokyo, and two MLB Spring Breakout games—this preseason promises plenty of action to gear us up for the regular season. Check out the full Cubs Spring Training TV schedule below.

You can use an over-the-air (OTA) antenna to catch some Chicago Cubs games on FOX for free this season. Antennas aren’t free, but you don’t need a TV subscription. Just use the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to check your area’s channels. Then, visit our Best OTA Antennas page for recommendations like the Mohu Leaf 50, which is ideal for suburban households.

Another viewing option is the Free Game of the Day on MLB.TV. Create an account on MLB.com to stream a free game each day of the regular season, but be aware of potential regional blackouts.

You can also try a free live TV streaming trial from services like DIRECTV STREAM, Fubo, and YouTube TV. Our top pick for MLB action is DIRECTV STREAM, which has core national channels and most RSNs—including Marquee Sports Network and Chicago Sports Network.

How to watch the Chicago Cubs FAQ

What streaming service has Chicago Cubs games?

Most live TV streaming services have Cubs games, but DIRECTV STREAM is our favorite because of its national and in-market coverage. MLB.TV is available for streaming out-of-market games, while Apple TV+ shows exclusive matches.

How can I watch Marquee without cable?

You can watch Marquee Sports Network without cable via a standalone online subscription for $19.99 per month. The channel is also available through DIRECTV STREAM and Fubo, but you must live within the Cubs TV territory to watch live in-market games.

Can I watch Cubs games on Amazon Prime?

Yes, out-of-market Cubs fans can watch games on Amazon Prime Video by getting an MLB.TV subscription through Prime Video Channels.

Are Cubs games on Sling TV?

Yes, you can watch nationally televised Cubs games on Sling TV. But you’ll need the Sling Orange + Blue plan to get ESPN and FOX Sports channels together. MLB Network and MLB Network Strike Zone are available in the Sports Extra add-on.

Where can I watch the Iowa Cubs game?

Some Iowa Cubs games air on Marquee Sports Network. But most Minor League Baseball games stream on MLB At Bat via MLB.TV—including most matchups featuring the Cubs’ Triple-A affiliate.

Why you should trust us

Our sports experts listed every Chicago Cubs game this season and researched local and national broadcast details. Using that information, we chose the best TV services for watching games by analyzing prices, channel guides, and ease of use.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: The Ultimate Guide To Watching the Los Angeles Dodgers in 2025
item.dc:creator: Chantel Buchi
item.description:
Learn how to watch every Los Angeles Dodgers game on TV this MLB season with our viewing guide—featuring game times, channel listings, and more.

The post The Ultimate Guide To Watching the Los Angeles Dodgers in 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Just one year removed from winning the World Series, the Los Angeles Dodgers have to try a little harder if they want to get back there.

The Dodgers beat the Cincinnati Reds in the National League Wild Card Series. Now they’re set to play the Philadelphia Phillies in the Division Series, but will have to start with two games on the road. The Dodgers were the only team to sweep their Wild Card series.

To keep up with all the action, keep reading this complete watch guide.

2025 Los Angeles Dodgers playoffs TV schedule

The schedule shifts to the City of Brotherly Love for the Dodgers starting on Saturday, October 4. The best-of-five series will be a difficult one for L.A., but we’re also talking about the defending champions.

See the full playoffs schedule below. I’ll update it throughout the series as more information becomes available.

Which channels have Los Angeles Dodgers games?

You can catch every 2025 Dodgers games on FOX, FS1, ESPN, MLB Network, TBS, SportsNet LA, and Apple TV+.

If you don’t live in or near the City of Angels, you won’t get access to the regional sports network SportsNet LA. So, if you live somewhere like Baltimore and want to keep up with Ohtani and Yoshinobu Yamamoto among The Boys In Blue, you’ll need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to watch games broadcasted on this RSN.

Dodgers fans will want ESPN for the final year of Sunday Night Baseball games, and you might also consider signing up for Apple TV+ to stream some Friday Night Baseball games.

Need quicker internet to support streaming live MLB games?

No Dodgers fan wants their stream to lag in the middle of a tied ninth inning. Enter your zip code below to find the best internet providers near you.

How can I watch the Dodgers Spring Training games?

SportNet LA will broadcast most, if not all, of the LA Dodgers’ 2025 Spring Training matchups. If you strike out on this RSN, you might be able to watch some on MLB Network or stream them on ESPN+. We’ll update the Spring Training TV schedule below as more info comes out.

Don’t forget: Toward the end of Spring Training, the Dodgers and Chicago Cubs will kick off the 2025 MLB regular season early on March 18 and 19. The two-game series will take place in Tokyo, Japan, and air on FOX Sports channels.

For a one-time cost of as little as $20, an OTA antenna gives you unrestricted access to all LA Dodgers games aired on FOX. To watch The Blue Crew’s games on FOX for free every season going forward, make sure to grab a top-level antenna.

You can watch several Dodgers games during the regular season at no cost with Free Game of the Day on MLB.TV. Create an account on MLB.com and check each morning which MLB game is streaming that day.

And our last-at-bat suggestion is to jump on a free live TV streaming trial with DIRECTV STREAM, Fubo, and YouTube TV. You can indulge in streaming free MLB games for up to one week.

Why you should trust us

Our sports experts put together a thorough rundown of every Los Angeles Dodgers Spring Training and regular-season game, along with the channels Dodgers fans need for this season. With only a few TV services having the SportsNet LA regional sports network in their lineup, we strive to save you time and money by laying out the TV providers a Dodgers fan will want.
